items.title: From England contender to reputation in tatters - Potter's fall from grace
items.summary: Graham Potter's sacking by West Ham caps a spectacular fall from grace for a man once touted as a future England manager, writes Phil McNulty.

items.title: Can set-piece coach get Newcastle's giants firing again?
items.summary: Newcastle United have only scored one goal from set-plays this season and boss Eddie Howe knows his towering side have "work to do".

items.title: Newcastle a 'must-win' game for Arsenal - Keown
items.summary: Ex-Arsenal defender Martin Keown and former Wales captain Ashley Williams tell BBC Football Focus that Sunday's game at Newcastle is "a must-win game" for the Gunners.

items.title: Five things we learned from Welsh URC openers
items.summary: The talking points from the Welsh clubs' start to the United Rugby Championship as Cardiff win but Dragons, Ospreys and Scarlets lose.

items.title: McIlroy & Lowry silence New York crowd on famous European day
items.summary: After facing abuse from American fans which "crossed the line", Rory McIlroy and Shane Lowry lead Europe towards a rare Ryder Cup away win.

items.title: Destined for greatness - why Donald's Europe are set to win Ryder Cup
items.summary: Europe's 6-2 demolition job of the US to take an 11Â½-4Â½ lead into the singles has seemingly made Sunday a formality.

items.title: Europe build lead on feisty second day at Ryder Cup
items.summary: Tempers fray at Bethpage Black in New York as Europe continue to dominate Team USA on day two of the Ryder Cup.

items.title: Scheffler's struggles invite unwanted Woods comparison
items.summary: Scottie Scheffler is the dominant world number one. But, like his predecessor Tiger Woods, the American is struggling in Ryder Cup pairings.

items.title: DeGale wins on bare-knuckle boxing debut
items.summary: Britain's James DeGale wins by unanimous decision against Matt Floyd on his bare-knuckle boxing debut in Manchester.

items.title: 'Well coached, well organised' - How Crystal Palace impressed against Liverpool
items.summary: Match of the Day's Alan Shearer looks at why Crystal Palace's players being comfortable in their system helped them beat Liverpool in the Premier League.

items.title: Fitzpatrick and Hatton side-by-side on final green
items.summary: European pair Matt Fitzpatrick and Tyrrell Hatton hit their approach shots to identical positions on the final green as they earn a 1UP victory in the fourballs over Sam Burns and Patrick Cantlay.

items.title: McGill and Murphy reach British Open final
items.summary: Anthony McGill will play Shaun Murphy in the final of the British Open after winning four consecutive frames to beat compatriot John Higgins.

items.title: How Amorim's constant changes made it hard for Man Utd
items.summary: Micah Richards looks at the mid-game changes made by Ruben Amorim and how they may have only made things more difficult for Manchester United at Brentford.

items.title: Saints snatch stunning play-off victory at Leeds
items.summary: Shane Wright scores with the final play of the game to snatch a sensational Super League play-off eliminator victory against Leeds at a stunned Headingley.

items.title: Rose clashes with DeChambeau and caddie
items.summary: Justin Rose is involved in a heated exchange with Bryson DeChambeau after the European golfer asks DeChambeau's caddy to move off the green while he was lining up a putt on the 15th hole.

items.title: Palhinha rescues late point for Spurs against Wolves
items.summary: Joao Palhinha rescues a point for Tottenham Hotspur with an injury-time equaliser against Wolves.

items.title: Alderete gives Sunderland victory as Postecoglou remains winless at Forest
items.summary: Ange Postecoglou's difficult start to life as Nottingham Forest head coach continues as Omar Alderete's first-half goal gives Sunderland victory at the City Ground.

items.title: Bournemouth rescue point at Leeds with late equaliser
items.summary: Eli Kroupi scores a stoppage-time equaliser to salvage a Premier League point for Bournemouth at Leeds United.

items.title: Haaland double helps Man City hit five past Burnley
items.summary: Erling Haaland scores twice late on and Maxime Esteve inadvertently scores two own goals to help Manchester City to a thumping Premier League victory over Burnley.

items.title: Brighton come from behind to beat 10-man Chelsea
items.summary: Danny Welbeck scores twice as Brighton come from behind to beat an ill-disciplined Chelsea side who have a player sent off for the second Saturday running.

items.title: Brentford beat Man Utd after Fernandes misses penalty
items.summary: Manchester United skipper Bruno Fernandes has a second-half penalty saved as Ruben Amorim's side slip to a Premier League defeat at Brentford.

items.title: Nketiah stoppage-time Palace winner subjects Liverpool to first league defeat
items.summary: Eddie Nketiah strikes with virtually the last kick of an enthralling encounter at Selhurst Park to give Crystal Palace a deserved victory and end Premier League leaders Liverpool's five-match winning start to the season.

items.title: Factor Protein Plus Meals Review (2025): Filling, Not Fattening
items.summary: After most of a week air-frying Factorâ€™s delivery high-protein meals, I realize I could probably live like this.

items.title: 'England's Rugby World Cup win will change these girls' lives'
items.summary: By beating Canada in front of a world record crowd at Twickenham, England put to bed the ghost of the 2022 Women's World Cup final.

items.title: 'World Cup win will change these girls' lives'
items.summary: By beating Canada in front of a world record crowd at Twickenham, England put to bed the ghost of the 2022 Women's World Cup final.

items.title: Man Utd & Liverpool want Branthwaite - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Liverpool and Manchester United want Everton defender Jarrad Branthwaite, Atletico Madrid are interested in Mason Greenwood, plus more.

items.title: Sunderland win continues strong start for promoted trio
items.summary: With Sunderland's win at Nottingham Forest continuing a strong start for the newly-promoted sides, we look at the stats behind the trio's success.

items.title: Why OpenAIâ€™s solution to AI hallucinations would kill ChatGPT tomorrow
items.summary: OpenAI has published a new paper identifying why ChatGPT is prone to making things up. Unfortunately, the problem may be unfixable.

items.title: Researchers uncover hidden ingredients behind AI creativity
items.summary: Image generators are designed to mimic their training data, so where does their apparent creativity come from? A recent study suggests that it's an inevitable by-product of their architecture.

items.title: We are not ruthless enough - Postecoglou
items.summary: Ange Postecoglou's nightmare start to life as Nottingham Forest manager continued on Saturday with defeat by Sunderland a fifth game without a victory, but are there positives from the performances?

items.title: 'Give us respect' - McIlroy swears at fans amid jeering
items.summary: After breaking away from an approach shot to swear at fans who were jeering, Rory McIlroy says the crowd at the Ryder Cup can "say whatever they want to me in between shots" but they should "give us the respect" whilst they are playing.

items.title: How cracks have appeared between Maresca and Chelsea
items.summary: Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca appears to have lost credit in the bank from last season, heightened by a defeat by Brighton.

items.title: England's Mitchell named women's coach of year
items.summary: England's World Cup-winning head coach John Mitchell is named World Rugby women's coach of the year.

items.title: 'Glasner's pulsating Palace brutally expose Liverpool flaws'
items.summary: Oliver Glasner's thrilling Crystal Palace side are on the march as they brutally expose Liverpool's weaknesses, says chief football writer Phil McNulty

items.title: South Africa thump Argentina to go top of Rugby Championship
items.summary: Sacha Feinberg-Mngomezulu breaks South Africa's individual scoring record with 37 points as they beat Argentina 67-30 to return to the top of the Rugby Championship.

items.title: Hostess Is Bringing Back A Fan-Favorite Treat & Fans Are STOKED
items.summary: "Delicious blast from the past!"

items.title: 'Women's sport is on a high' - Jones & Kildunne on World Cup win
items.summary: England's Ellie Kildunne and Meg Jones reflect on an amazing day after the Red Roses win the Rugby World Cup final in front nearly 82,000 fans at Twickenham.

items.title: Atletico score five to beat Real in Madrid derby
items.summary: Atletico Madrid fight back from behind to inflict defeat on Real Madrid for the first time this season in a pulsating Madrid derby.

items.title: 'I wanted to be next Steven Gerrard' - the making of Kildunne
items.summary: Ellie Kildunne went from not having a rugby club to playing for England in four years. A World Cup win would confirm the sport's new superstar.

items.title: 'A culture to win' - how have Man City turned form around?
items.summary: After the disappointing end to August, September had the potential to turn into a crisis for Manchester City and manager Pep Guardiola, but they have turned their form around.

items.title: RAF and plumbing: The lives of England's World Cup final stars
items.summary: England's players will be fully focused on their game when they take on Canada in Saturday's Women's Rugby World Cup final - but they know what it's like to combine sport with a full-time job.

items.title: Dominant England beat Canada to win Rugby World Cup
items.summary: England have won their third Rugby World Cup title with a commanding 13-33 performance over Canada in front of an 81,885 person home crowd in Twickenham.

items.title: Maskill sets world record as GB end with 40 medals
items.summary: Poppy Maskill wins women's butterfly gold in a record time as Great Britain finish the World Para Swimming Championships in Singapore with 40 medals.

items.title: Angry McIlroy swears at rowdy US fans in Ryder Cup

items.title: Gear News of the Week: The iPhone Air Is Surprisingly Repairable, and Gemini Comes to Google TV
items.summary: Plus: Withings collabs with Clue to offer advanced womenâ€™s cycle tracking, thereâ€™s a new Balmuda toaster, and Shokz shows off Dolby Audioâ€“powered open earbuds.

items.title: WIRED Roundup: Groypers Are Going Mainstream
items.summary: On today's episode of Uncanny Valley, we cover everything from what exactly the DHS is doing with Americans' DNA, to the rising influence of Nick Fuentes.

items.title: It's official: Humans have found 6,000 planets beyond our solar system
items.summary: Just two decades after astronomers discovered the first exoplanet, NASA has confirmed the existence of 6,000 alien worlds. The total will rise even quicker as next-generation telescopes take flight.

items.title: Why does medicine taste bad?
items.summary: Medicines help us recover from illness, but sometimes they taste gross. Why is that?

items.title: All Blacks beat Australia to retain Bledisloe Cup for 23rd year in a row
items.summary: New Zealand retain the Bledisloe Cup with a 33-24 victory over Australia in Auckland.

items.title: Humble & sweet, but a lion - the story of the first female Â£1m player
items.summary: Meet the person behind women's football's first Â£1m player, Arsenal's new superstar forward Olivia Smith.

items.title: 'People looked at me like I was a something, not someone'
items.summary: In a candid interview, World Cup winner Heather Fisher discusses losing her hair and the struggle she had with her identity.

items.title: 'He fixes what needs fixing' - why Raducanu turned to Nadal's ex-coach
items.summary: Emma Raducanu recently appointed another full-time coach in Spaniard Francisco Roig - BBC Sport speaks to those who know him best.

items.title: 'He has made young players dream' - the making of Liverpool icon Salah
items.summary: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

items.title: Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in fight in US
items.summary: The story of Becky Zerlentes - the first female boxer to die in a sanctioned fight in the United States.

items.title: Lucy Bronze - the making of England's most decorated player
items.summary: This is the story of England defender Lucy Bronze, who is no stranger to winning and hopes for more success at Euro 2025.
